p: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), approximately 80% of the worldâ€™s population depends on herbal remedies for their primary healthcare [ 44, 45]. This study showed the different chemical composition in essential oils of different parts of L. pubescens and the different antibacterial activity of ethyl acetate extracts of these plant parts. These properties could be successfully exploited to treat several diseases caused by bacterial infections. This may indicate that lavender species used in traditional remedies may possess beneficial biological activity. Thus, this study suggests the potential use of L. pubescens roots, stems, leaves, and flowers in traditional herbal medicine applications.
